title: ERROR powchain: Unable to retrieve latest execution client header error=HeaderByNumber: not found
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description When I use w3.get_block_number(), I found it stuck at 17329769, and it failed to get_block():"Block with id: '0x1086e69' not found." get_block_number() didnt update for many hours. When I see Prysm, it continues to show ERROR powchain: Unable to retrieve latest execution client header error=HeaderByNumber: not found ### Has this worked before in a previous version? I didnt use any previoud version ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ## üî• Error 
=6514892 syncBitsCount=505 txCount=217

## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
Intel(R) Xeon(R) Gold 5220R CPU
memory 1TB
ssd 3.7TB, less than 50% used
centos7.6
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
v4.02
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**
Hi @5yh this seems like an issue with your execution client. Which one are you using? Have you tried restarting it? It seems like it may have gotten stuck
